required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of SCT200 in Patients With Relapsed or Metastatic Triple Receptor Negative Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Recombinant Anti-EGFR Monoclonal Antibody（SCT200） in Patients With Relapsed or Metastatic Triple Receptor Negative Breast Cancer : a Phase Ⅱ, Open-label, Single-arm, Multicenter Study

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of recombinant anti-EGFR monoclonal antibody（SCT200）in patients with triple receptor negative breast cancer treated after failure of standard therapy (including Anthracyclines and/or Taxanes).

detailed_description.textblock: This open label,single-arm multicenter phase II study is designed to evaluate Objective Response Rate (ORR) in advanced triple receptor negative breast cancer treated with anti-EGFR monoclonal antibody SCT200.

primary_outcome.description: ORR is defined as proportion of patients achieving complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) according to RECIST v1.1 during trial treatment.

secondary_outcome.description: AE are assessed according to NCI CTCAE v4.03.
PFS is defined as the time from first dose of SCT200 until the date of first documentation of progression or date of death, whichever occurs first,according to RECIST v1.1 criteria.

DOR is defined as time from the date when a patient first meets the criteria for CR or PR according to RECIST v1.1, until the date that progressive disease (PD) is objectively documented or death, whichever occurs first.
The achievement of any a stable response（SD）, partial response (PR) or complete response (CR), according to RECIST v1.1 criteria.
TTP is defined as the time from first dose of SCT200 until the date of first documentation of progressive disease (PD), according to RECIST v1.1 criteria.
OS is defined as time from first dose of SCT200 until the date of death from any cause.

arm_group.description: Initially, 6.0mg/kg of SCT200 will be administered once a week for a maximum of 6 cycles. After 6 cycles, 8.0mg/kg of SCT200 will be administered every two weeks until disease progression.

overall_official.affiliation: Cancer Hospital Affiliated to Harbin Medical University

facility.name: Cancer Hospital Affiliated to Harbin Medical University
